description: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) requires the services of two Psychologists to perform specialized clinical psychological assessments to address fitness for duty, disability management and performance related issues for regular and civilian members; to conduct psychological debriefings within specialized sections/deployments; to conduct psychological screening assessments for applicants to the RCMP; to coordinate the Critical Incident Stress Management (CISM) program and provide/oversee critical incident intervention for members and their families; and to coordinate and deliver preventative health programs in collaboration with F Division and T Division Health Services teams.
full_summary:
## Divisonal Psycholgists - RFP

**Bid Opportunity ID:** cb-9160-46653863 | **Bid Solicitation ID:** M5000-24-0702/A

**Title:** Division Psychologists
**Location:** Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada

**Bid Status:** Expired

**Solicitation Overview:**

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking proposals from qualified psychologists to provide specialized clinical psychological assessments and services to its members, including fitness for duty, disability management, and performance-related issues. Two contracts may be awarded, each with a one-year term and potential for up to four one-year extensions.

**Key Services:**

* Conduct clinical psychological assessments to address fitness for duty, disability management, and performance-related issues
* Provide debriefing services after critical incidents
* Conduct psychological screening assessments for RCMP applicants
* Coordinate and deliver preventative health programs
* Provide critical incident stress management services

**Requirements:**

* Two psychologists will be required to provide services: one for Division F (32 hours/week) and one for Division T (24 hours/week)
* Availability to work after hours or on weekends or statutory holidays as required
* Successful bidders will be required to meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria
* Bids will be evaluated based on lowest priced responses.

**Bid Submission:**

Bid submissions are due on **October 11th, 2023** at 15:00:00. Bids must be submitted electronically to [NWR_Procurement_Bids@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:NWR_Procurement_Bids@rcmp-grc.gc.ca).

**Additional Information:**

* Procurement method: Competitive - Open bidding
* Basis of selection: Lowest Price
* Contract duration: Up to 5 years (1 base year + 4 optional extensions)
* Anticipated start dates: April 1, 2024 and July 1, 2024

**Note:**

* The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada.
* Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier.
* Bidders are advised to regularly consult the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) for updates on this procurement opportunity.

**Contact Information:**

Dino Cavalic
dino.cavalic@rcmp-grc.gc.ca | (587) 335-6809
NWR_Procurement_Bids@rcmp-grc.gc.ca | [www.canadabu
